newsitem.title: CHILE: Chilean utilities mull natgas pipeline project.
newsitem.headline: Chilean utilities mull natgas pipeline project.

text.p: Chilean state power company Colbun Machicura SA said it has held talks with generator Empresa Nacional de Electricidad (Endesa) on building a natural gas pipeline in central Chile.

The duct would supply natural gas to power plants that the companies are planning to build near the town of Quillota. The gas will come from a pipeline being built by the GasAndes group from Mendoza in central Argentina across the Andes to Santiago.
"The most likely is that if we go ahead with this project, it would be with another company," said president Jaime Toha.
"Endesa is an electricity company which has interests similar to ours...we have discussed this issue (with Endesa)."
GasAndes is planning to build a pipeline to fuel the electricity stations, but Colbun believes it could be cheaper to build its own pipeline.
"We are considering different ways for transporting the gas, including the offer we have received from GasAndes as well as the possibility of developing our own scheme," said Toha.
"I hope we will reach a decision in the next few weeks."
Colbun and Endesa are planning to invest a total of $400 million in the gas-fired power plants which will each have capacity of 370 megawatts.
